DataElement.preferredName: Post Procedure Pain Present Hour Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the period of time regarding presence of pain after procedure in unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. regarding presence of pain after procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information regarding presence of pain after procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the period of time which something continues in unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
The period of time during which something continues.
